title: Middlesbrough transfer news: Aitor Karanka changes his stance on Gaston Ramirez’s future amid Leicester interest
text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments MIDDLESBROUGH boss Aitor Karanka has changed his stance on Gaston Ramirez’s future by admitting he will weigh up any offers for the star. 
The Spanish coach was adamant that there was “no chance” of the playmaker leaving the Riverside after last weekend’s game at Watford following reports of Leicester’s interest. Reuters 4 Aitor Karanka has changed his stance on Gaston Ramirez’s Boro future amid interest from Leicester 
But as SunSport exclusively revealed on Monday , the Uruguayan could force Karanka’s hand after setting his heart on a switch to the reigning Premier League champions. 
Keep up-to-date with all the latest transfer news and gossip in the January window with SunSport’s daily LIVE blog 
Speaking ahead of this weekend’s clash with West Ham , Karanka was asked whether the 26-year-old was unhappy at the club. 
He said: “He is with the medical staff so I have not spoken to him. I think he was more unhappy at Southampton when he was not playing. related stories All the latest breaking news and gossip from the January transfer window JACK OF CLUBS Jack Wilshere could be off to his third club in a year with AC Milan set to swoop when Bournemouth loan ends CHERRIE PICKER Chelsea demand at least £12m from Bournemouth for out-of-favour goalkeeper Asmir Begovic depay the price Lyon president Jean-Michel Aulas says Memphis Depay is chomping at bit to show his 'immense talent' 
“There is no chance of him leaving at the moment because we have not received one offer for him. 
“Again, if the offer arrives and he wants to leave then we will consider it. Today I don’t think it should happen.” 
Speculation first emerged last week that the ex-Hull City man was wanted by Claudio Ranieri’s Foxes. Reuters Aitor Karanka is willing to allow the star to leave… For the right price Reuters Ramirez only joined Middlesbrough last January Getty Images 4 Ramirez has scored twice in 17 Premier League matches for Boro this season 
Reports in Italy suggested that he had a £15million release fee in his Boro contract and Leicester were prepared to meet that. 
The club have denied that the clause exists, but a figure of around £10m is expected to be enough to tempt Karanka into selling the attacker. 
Ramirez will definitely miss Saturday’s home game against the Hammers with a knee injury. Gaston Ramirez grabs solo goal for Middlesbrough v Bournemouth Middlesbrough 1-0 Hull : Gaston Ramirez goal leaves Tigers in drop zone 
Middlesbrough already have a ready-made replacement lined-up in Stoke City’s Bojan. 
They will use the cash from Ramirez’s sale to bring the former Barceona star to the Riverside. 
And they bolstered their forward line earlier in the week as Patrick Bamford returned to the club on a permanent basis from Chelsea. Watch all the Premier League action in our Weekend Premier League round-up
